project_description: A simple Flutter application that toggles between displaying 'Cat' and 'Dog' text with corresponding icons when tapped.
architecture_overview: The app uses a modular structure with a clear separation of concerns. State management is handled by Cubit, and the app is designed following the best practices in Flutter development.

files.name: lib/main.dart
files.description: The main entry point of the application. Sets up the Cubit provider and initializes the app.

methods.name: main
methods.description: Main method to run the Flutter app.

files.name: lib/cubits/animal_cubit.dart
files.description: Cubit for managing the state of the displayed animal.

files.name: lib/models/animal_state.dart
files.description: State class representing the current animal.

files.name: lib/screens/animal_screen.dart
files.description: Main screen of the app that displays the current animal and handles user interactions.

widgets.name: AnimalScreen
widgets.description: Main screen displaying the current animal and icon, allowing the user to toggle the state by tapping.

cubits.name: AnimalCubit
cubits.description: Manages the state of the displayed animal, toggling between 'Cat' and 'Dog'.

methods.name: toggleAnimal
methods.description: Toggles the displayed animal between 'Cat' and 'Dog'.

models.name: AnimalState
models.description: Represents the current state of the animal being displayed.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> AnimalScreen : tap
AnimalScreen -> AnimalCubit : toggleAnimal()
AnimalCubit -> AnimalState : new state
AnimalState --> AnimalCubit : updated
AnimalCubit --> AnimalScreen : updated state
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AnimalCubit handles toggling the state between 'Cat' and 'Dog'. When the user taps on the screen, the AnimalCubit toggles the state, which updates the AnimalState. The updated state is then reflected in the UI.
navigation_flow: The application consists of a single screen (AnimalScreen). No additional navigation is involved.
